3.94. 
Power of attorney to manage property 
1. One spouse may authorise the other spouse to manage, use or dispose of property which is their community property in his or her discretion. 
2. If one of the spouses is absent or for other important reasons is unable to manage jointly the joint property, the other spouse may apply to the court for permission to manage such property alone. 
3. If a spouse who alone manages property which is community property does so negligently or unreasonably and carelessly, he or she must compensate out of his or her own personal property for any loss caused by his or her fault. 
4. The provisions of Book IV of this Code governing the administration of another person's property shall apply mutatis mutandis to the administration of property.
